name: softwood forestry, mixed species, boreal forest | sawlog and veneer log, softwood, measured as solid wood under bark | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10551/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 m³ of softwood sawlog, measured as solid wood under bark, from forestlands mostly located in the boreal forest of the province of Québec (Canada). The harvested species is black spruce (80% of the harvested volume) with a density of 406 kg/m3 (oven dry mass over green volume). 66% of the total harvestable wood volume in Québec is softwood (forestierenchef.gouv.qc.ca).;This dataset was created with a model specific to the Québec context. Therefore a comparison with the other forestry datasets has to be done carefully.

From the construction of forest roads.

This activity ends with sawlog at forest road. The dataset includes harvest, scarification, forest camp establishment and operation, forest road construction and maintenance and reforestation. The dataset doesn"t include seedling production and emissions from the degradation of wood residues left on forest floor.

Forest coproducts (i.e.. branches and tops) are not considered because they are left on the ground. Other coproducts (e.g. strains) are illegal to harvest in Québec.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from boreal forestlands in Québec, Canada.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mechanised production with whole-tree harvesting and stem-only harvesting.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Mostly primary data from boreal forestlands (approximately 70 forest contractors) located in the province of Québec (Canada). Estimated data include biomass energy content.
